p: Vector control remains the core strategy for the prevention of dengue [ 15, 16]. However, current approaches that only temporarily affect mosquito populations have not been proven to be sufficient to prevent dengue transmission [ 17]. Effective and sustainable dengue prevention and control requires innovation, by integrating and making optimal use of the most effective control tools available like integrated vector management, and also the introduction of new tools e.g. vaccines and other novel vector control technologies, especially in growing and complex urban environments [ 18, 19].
